executive_summary: The Activated Carbon Manufacturing industry has continued to be subject to influence from an intensified focus on environmental policy. Activated carbon is processed with oxygen to create pores between carbon atoms, increasing their surface area and enabling activated carbon to absorb contaminants as liquid or gas passes through it. Activated carbon is used primarily for water treatment and air purification. A range of downstream industrial sectors rely on activated carbon for the removal of impurities. The industry is beholden to industrial production activity as it is typically correlated with the issuance of additional contaminants and an increased need for activated carbon products.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Stagnant Growth in Industrial Production and Rising Input Costs Have Inhibited Revenue
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The industrial production index, along with investment in industrial equipment, has wavered since 2018, siphoning away much of the demand for activated carbon manufacturing. The proliferation of activated carbon manufacturers in emerging markets has intensified competition for domestic activated carbon manufacturers, causing industry revenue to decline. Demand began to bounce back in 2021 as the economy was recovering from the pandemic. This period of economic recovery significantly increased worldwide demand for coal, causing input costs to rise for the industry.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: A Strong US Dollar Has Made Domestic Products Relatively Expensive for Foreign Consumers
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: As indicated by an increase in the trade-weighted index (TWI) and rise of input costs, domestic enterprises struggled against competition despite stable downstream demand.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Hikes in Domestic and Global Downstream Demand Propel the Industry Forward
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Demand for activated carbon will improve as the industry distances itself from the disruptions that occurred at the height of the pandemic.
Despite increased competition from new entrants and mounting imports, industry profit is expected to rise.
Downstream demand will persist in manufacturing industries, benefiting industry demand.
A depreciating US dollar will make exports more competitive on the global market.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: GOVERNMENT FUNDING WILL SUPPORT DEMAND FOR ACTIVATED CARBON MANUFACTURING
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act will provide opportunities for the industry.

industry_definition: Companies in this industry manufacture activated carbon, which is a form of carbon that has been processed to make it extremely porous.

opportunities: High Performance Drivers: World price of steaming coal

key_trends: Fierce competition based around price and quality.
Intense import competition in this industry.
Struggling industrial production activity amid work stoppages during the pandemic.

market_segmentation.segment_description: To create pure water, all the contaminants in surface, groundwater, waterways, or wastewater streams must be removed.
Activated carbon is used to meet emission regulations to protect the environment.
Activated carbon products are used in the food industry.

international_trade_points.trade_description: Mexico is expected to be the largest export destination.

FAQs.question: Does your company specialize in one corner of the market or produce a diversified range of products?
Are your sales heavily dependent on the health of the US economy?
FAQs.answer: The industry is dependent on demand from downstream industrial manufacturers.
